summary.p: 133 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: M. 3; Text: Q 9:70-Q 32:22; 14 lines per page; Dimensions: 355 x 260 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 1st (7th) to 2nd (8th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 1: "2 M. 3 Aynı Eser Parşömen. 260mm boy ve 355mm eninde cönk şeklinde 133 yaprak. Sahifede kûfi yazı ile 290mm uzunl.[uğunda] 14 satır. Tahminen I - II (VII - VIII) asırda yazılmıştır. Sure başları kırmızı, nefhi, sarı ve sepya ile hendesî ve geçmeli tezyinatı havidir. Miklep ve şemseli koyu zeytunî deri cilt. Bu mushaf Tavba (9) suresinin 70. ayetinin اتتهم رسلهم بالبينات cümlesiyle başlayıp Sacda (32) suresinin 22. ayeti ومن اظلمkelimesiyle bitiyor."

This can be translated as follows: "2 M. 3 A Codex of the Qurʾān Parchment. 133 oblong/horizontally shaped leaves of 260 mm height and 355 mm width. The text area, written in Kufic script [contains] 14 lines measuring 290 mm. Probably copied during the 1st and 2nd (7th and 8th) centuries. Sūra beginnings contain red, dark green, yellow, and sepia geometric and interlaced painted decorations. Dark olive-coloured leather binding with flap (miklep) and a mandorla (şemse). The codex begins with اتتهم رسلهم بالبينات of Q 9:70 (Sūra al-Tawba) and ends with the words ومن اظلم of Q 32:22 (Sūra al-Sajda)."
